trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl"></xref> class is used with an LDAP search function to specify the server used to verify the existence of an object.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl.#ctor(System.String)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl"></xref> class using the specified server name.
The global catalog the performs the validation.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl"></xref> class using the specified server name and flags.
The global catalog that performs the validation.
The flags used for the validation.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl.Flag"></xref> property contains the flag used for validation.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl.GetValue"></xref> method returns the name of the validation server.
The name of the validation server.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.VerifyNameControl.ServerName"></xref> property contains the name of the server that performs the validation.
The name of the server that performs the validation.
